metadata.name: Root Certificate Installed - PowerShell
metadata.comment: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('move-item')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('cert:\\localmachine\\root')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('import-certificate')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('cert:\\localmachine\\root')))

output.summary: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

metadata.objective: False positive: Help Desk or IT may need to manually add a corporate Root CA on occasion. Need to test if GPO push doesn't trigger FP Reference: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1553.004/T1553.004.md
